name: TrendCT Hackathon
body:
# Small State, Big Debate

##### Welcome to the TrendCT and Connecticut Mirror hackathon on disparate treatment by race.

Between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. (or earlier), we will focus on creating useful tools or extracting unexpected stories from Connecticut's racial profiling data, which records every traffic stop in the state.

It is a comprehensive database that aims to diagnose where racial profiling may be happening. We are able to work on this unique data set thanks to the tireless work from the [Institute for Municipal and Regional Policy](http://www.ccsu.edu/imrp/) at Central Connecticut State University and the [Connecticut Data Collaborative](http://ctdata.org/).

#### Communication

We have a Slack channel! 

https://dataconn.slack.com/

The channel for everyone is #ctrace-hackathon.

If you don't have a login, let me know.

#### Hashtags

If you're tweeting, please use #ctrace

#### The traffic stop data
* raw - [Oct. 2013 - Sep. 2015](http://ctrp3viz.s3.amazonaws.com/data/Connecticut_102013_32015.csv)
* map - [Oct. 2013 - Sep. 2015](http://ctrp3viz.s3.amazonaws.com/data/Connecticut_102013_32015.csv)
* data portal - [Oct. 2013 - Sep. 2015](http://ctrp3.ctdata.org/rawdata/)

#### IMRP reports and methodology
* September 2014 report [[CTData.org]](http://ctrp3viz.s3.amazonaws.com/data/report_0914.pdf)
* April 2015 Report [[CTData.org]](http://ctrp3viz.s3.amazonaws.com/data/April%202015%20Connecticut%20Racial%20Profiling%20Report.pdf)
* Exploring the statistical techniques used in the Institute for Municipal and Regional Policy report  [[CTData.org]](http://ctrp3.ctdata.org/news/report_story)

#### Stories from the data
* Summary graphics [[CTData.org]](http://ctrp3.ctdata.org/news/year_two_first_look)
* Police being kinder, gentler to drivers in Connecticut [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/09/24/how-frequently-police-departments-pull-over-and-ticket-drivers/)
* Quiz: What correlates with traffic tickets per town? [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/08/04/tickets-correlation-quiz/) / [methodology](http://trendct.github.io/ct-tickets/correlator.html)
* When do police most often pull over drivers? And for what? [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/07/06/police-tickets-in-connecticut/) / [methodology](http://trendct.github.io/ct-tickets/incidents_analysis.html)
* Police departments that stopped the most drivers in Connecticut [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/07/13/police-departments-that-hand-out-the-most-traffic-tickets-in-connecticut/) / [methodology](http://trendct.github.io/ct-tickets/department_analysis.html)
* Who gets off with a warning after a traffic stop in Connecticut? [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/07/16/who-gets-let-off-with-a-warning-after-a-traffic-stop-by-police-in-connecticut/) / [methodology](http://trendct.github.io/ct-tickets/warnings_analysis.html)
* What time of day drivers get ticketed most in Connecticut [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/07/15/what-time-of-day-drivers-get-ticketed-the-most-in-connecticut/) / [methodology](http://trendct.github.io/ct-tickets/ticket_time_analysis.html)
* Q&A with the CT Data Collaborative: What to watch out for when analyzing the racial profiling data [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/04/09/qa-connecticut-racial-profiling-prohibition-project-data-portal-from-the-ct-data-collaborative/)
* Connecticut’s deep data dive on racial profiling [[The CT Mirror]](http://ctmirror.org/2015/04/07/connecticuts-deep-data-dive-on-racial-profiling/)

#### Previous hackathon project
* See traffic stops by badge number [[CTicket]](https://cticket.herokuapp.com/)

#### Additional useful data
* Census data  [[Census Reporter]](http://censusreporter.org/)
* Town speed limits [[Department of Transportation]](http://www.ct.gov/dot/lib/dot/documents/dstc/townspeeds/townspeedmap.pdf)
* Average daily traffic (data) [[Department of Transportation]](http://projects.ctmirror.org/download/3-YearStationCycle-2011to2013_ADTs_1.xlsx)
* Average daily traffic (maps) [[Department of Transportation]](http://www.ct.gov/dot/cwp/view.asp?a=3532&q=567276)

* Which tool should I use? [[IRE]](http://ire.org/files/static_files/video/toolvideos.html)
* John, Jonathan, Johnny? How to merge them in Open Refine [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/04/24/john-jonathan-and-johnny-how-to-merge-them-in-open-refine/)
* Data Visualization for All [[Jack Dougherty]](http://www.datavizbook.org/)
* Tutorial: How to get data out of PDFs [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/07/24/tutorial-how-to-get-data-out-of-pdfs/)
* Tutorial: How to put dots on a Leaflet map with R [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/06/26/tutorial-how-to-put-dots-on-a-leaflet-map-with-r/)
* Tutorial: How I used Hartford’s open data to build my app [[TrendCT]](http://trendct.org/2015/05/08/tutorial-how-i-used-hartfords-open-data-to-build-my-app/)
